cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi (155 km) ENE of Daytona Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north then accelerate north-northeast, paralleling the Southeast U.S. coast and then passing well offshore of the Mid-Atlantic toward Nova Scotia.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Carolina or southern North Carolina coast (near Cape Fear/Cape Hatteras)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch north of Surf City NC to Poquoson VA; Tropical Storm Watch NC/VA border to Chincoteague VA and lower Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Volusia/Brevard County FL line to Ponte Vedra Beach FL and from north of Savannah River to Surf City NC; Tropical Storm Warning Sebastian Inlet FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast coast from Florida through the Carolinas, with outer impacts extending northward along the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; any gusts likely remain below gale force unless the track shifts markedly west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for New York Harbor; surge guidance focuses on the Carolinas to Virginia.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring 1–2 inches of rain late Friday into Saturday, below major-flood thresholds.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along New Jersey and Long Island beaches beginning late Thursday and persisting through the weekend.
